title: Aldi Australia set to release a gin that changes colour from blue to pink
text:
Aldi is set to launch a new type of gin that changes colour from blue to pink when mixers are added.

The McQueen Colour Changing Forest Fruits Gin, priced at $49.99, has been described by its creator as 'a little bit of theatre' in a bottle.

While the tipple was previously only available in the UK, Australian shoppers can now purchase the Instagram worthy-drop as part of the store's Special Buys, Wednesday 30 October.

The very special McQueen Colour Changing Forest Fruits Gin, priced at $49.99, has been described by its creator as 'a little bit of theatre' in a bottle

The spirit is made using the blue petals of the Asian butterfly flower in the distilling process

The spirit is made using the blue petals of the Asian butterfly flower in the distilling process.

When the pH levels (acidity levels) of the petals are altered, the drink changes colour from pale sapphire to pink.

Colour changes vary depending on the type of mixers you use, which means it entirely possible to create a signature drink.

Add a squeeze of lime first and see what shade of pink the gin goes, then add the tonic and it will change again.

Colour changes vary depending on the type of mixers you use, which means it entirely possible to create a signature drink (stock image)

According to Dale McQueen, managing director and co-founder of McQueen Gin , the spirit is also distilled using forest fruits, additions which gives it a distinct flavour.

'Not only does our new artisan gin taste great, but it also brings a little bit of theatre to gin o’clock,' he told The Independent.

'Perfect to share with friends, it’s a delicious fruity gin with a difference,' he said.

McQueen Forest Fruits Colour Changing Gin, priced at $49.99 will go on sale at Aldi Wednesday 30 October.
